intro: Pleurophora pulchra, commonly known as the showy pleurophora, is a species of flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Pleurophora pulchra thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks, and it plays a role in supporting local insect populations.
